intro: Lechea pulchella var. elegans, commonly known as the elegant lechea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
